comment._content: I would loved to have browsed through his shop!

comment.author: 62379908@N00
comment._content:
1897?  So everything in that picture is at least 114 years old -- IF it's still around.   George would be approaching 200.  

Oh for a time machine.   I love to explore places like that in this century.  Likely more fun in the 19th Century.

Maybe George is showing off an antique gun.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/howard33] Well, it does look fairly elderly alright! We need some input from gun experts...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: The gun looks like a front or barrel loading blunderbuss with flintlock action.  They were the ultimate scatter gun and could fire balls, nails, bits of metal and small pieces of stone.  They  were most unsporting and likely to maim anything in range as much as to kill them!  Stu, I was looking at that item of furniture and could not figure it out.  It might be an ornate dog kennel? (not really) or perhaps some sort of writing desk or glass/liquor cabinet.

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/39191857@N05] Thanks. I also thought it might be some sort of cabinet but without its lower part with the legs. For a 19th century cabinet, it's a very unusual style and have no idea which? If it's 19th century I'd guess the end panels were hadn-painted with some scene - perhaps a rural idyllic theme?
.
The guns certainly looks like some sort of short-barreled blunderbus but it will take someone knowledgeable in antique guns to tell us which make.

Just had a thought...if Mr. Deacon didn't leave his stuff outside in the street where it will get nicked he wouldn't need to spend his time guarding it !!

comment.author: 63844591@N04
comment._content: Shop stood on the corner of Colbeck Street and Spring Garden Alley in Waterford. It was demolished about 10 years ago for a new office building

comment.author: 35274523@N08
comment._content: Curiosity shop goes along with my curio shop! He is serious - going to shoot the thief. I wish we could do this in the mall where my booth is.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Here is Mr. Deacon in the 1901 census. I like the idea of Eclipse bargains! There was a near-total solar eclipse on 29th July 1897, visible in the Bahamas, and a good one of the Moon on August 12th, visible in Waterford!
